CVE IDs: ['AMD reported memory leak vulnerabilities in the AMD DXE driver in Server and Client desktops and mobile APUs/CPUs that could allow a highly privileged user to obtain sensitive information. AMD-SB-4007: CVE-2023-20594, CVE-2023-20597', 'A potential vulnerability was reported in the BIOS of some Lenovo Notebook products that could allow a local attacker with elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code. CVE-2023-5075', 'A potential vulnerability was reported in the BIOS of some Lenovo ThinkPad products that could allow a physical or local attacker with elevated privileges to tamper with BIOS firmware. CVE-2023-5078', 'A potential vulnerability was reported in the BIOS update tool driver for some Desktop, Smart Edge, Smart Office, and ThinkStation products that could allow a local user with elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code.\xa0CVE-2023-25493', 'Potential vulnerabilities were reported in the BIOS of some Desktop, Smart Edge, and ThinkStation products that could allow a local attacker with elevated privileges to write to NVRAM variables. CVE-2023-25494, CVE-2023-45075, CVE-2023-45076, CVE-2023-45077, CVE-2023-45078, CVE-2023-45079', 'Potential vulnerabilities were reported in the BIOS of some Lenovo Desktop products that could allow a local attacker with elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code or disclose sensitive information. CVE-2023-43567, CVE-2023-43568, CVE-2023-43569, CVE-2023-43570, CVE-2023-43571, CVE-2023-43572, CVE-2023-43573, CVE-2023-43574, CVE-2023-43575, CVE-2023-43576, CVE-2023-43577, CVE-2023-43578, CVE-2023-43579, CVE-2023-43580, CVE-2023-43581.']

Description:
AMI has released security enhancements for AMI BIOS.  No CVE available.

Mitigation Strategy for Customers (what you should do to protect yourself):

Intel Guidance for INTEL-SA-00828:
Intel determined this mitigation will be enabled by default in updated microcode. Users may be able to opt-out of the mitigation using hardware controls exposed by their OS/VMM, which can be used to avoid performance impact for affected workloads.  For most workloads, Intel has not observed reduced performance due to this mitigation. However, certain vectorization-heavy workloads may see some impact. Intel encourages customers to review our technical documentation to understand options available to reduce or eliminate any performance impact.
CVE IDs: ['AMD reported a SMM memory corruption vulnerability in SMM driver that could lead to arbitrary code execution.\xa0 AMD-SB-4003: CVE-2023-20555', 'AMD reported a side channel attack known as ‘Inception’ or ‘RAS Poisoning’ that may allow an attacker to influence branch prediction, potentially leading to information disclosure. AMD-SB-7005: CVE-2023-20569', 'Insyde reported the CapsuleIFWUSmm driver does not check the return value which may cause memory leak.\xa0 INSYDE-SA-2023018: CVE-2022-46897', 'Insyde reported an architectural flaw in how the Insyde H20 UEFI code handles configuring UEFI NVRAM variables.\xa0 INSYDE-SA-2023034: CVE-2023-26090', "Insyde reported some Insyde UEFI implementations do not correctly protect and validate information contained in the 'MeSetup' UEFI variable. INSYDE-SA-2023036: CVE-2023-27471", 'Insyde reported a time of check time of use (TOCTOU) access after measurement that allows redirected code execution.\xa0 INSYDE-SA-2023038: CVE-2022-24351', 'Insyde reported the FvbServicesRuntimeDxe SMM module exposes an SMI handler that allows an attacker to interact with the SPI flash at run-time from the OS. INSYDE-SA-2023039: CVE-2023-28468', 'Insyde reported an issue was discovered in SysPasswordDxe in Insyde InsydeH2O with kernel 5.0 through 5.5.\xa0 System password information could optionally be stored in cleartext. INSYDE-SA-2023047: CVE-2023-31041', 'Insyde reported an integer overflow vulnerability was discovered in Freetype in tt_hvadvance_adjust() function in src/truetype/ttgxvar.c. INSYDE-SA-2023048: CVE-2023-2004', 'Intel reported potential security vulnerabilities in the BIOS firmware for some Intel Processors that may allow escalation of privilege, information disclosure or denial of service.\xa0 2023.3 IPU - INTEL-SA-00813: CVE-2022-37343, CVE-2022-44611, CVE-2022-27879, CVE-2022-38083, CVE-2022-43505', 'Intel reported a potential security vulnerability in some Intel Processors that may allow information disclosure.\xa0 2023.3 IPU - INTEL-SA-00828: CVE-2022-40982', 'Intel reported an improper access control vulnerability in some 3rd Generation Intel Xeon Scalable processors that may allow a privileged user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access.\xa0 2023.3 IPU - INTEL-SA-00836: CVE-2023-23908', 'Intel reported a potential security vulnerability in some Intel Xeon Processors with Intel Software Guard Extensions (SGX) or Intel Trust Domain Extension (TDX) that may allow escalation of privilege.\xa0 2023.3 IPU - INTEL-SA-00837: CVE-2022-41804', 'A buffer overflow has been identified in the SetupUtility driver in some Lenovo Notebook products which may allow an attacker with local access and elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code. CVE-2023-34419', 'A buffer overflow has been identified in the SystemUserMasterHddPwdDxe driver in some Lenovo Notebook products which may allow an attacker with local access and elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code. CVE-2023-4028', 'A buffer overflow has been identified in the BoardUpdateAcpiDxe driver in some Lenovo ThinkPad products which may allow an attacker with local access and elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code. CVE-2023-4029', 'A vulnerability was reported in BIOS for ThinkPad P14s Gen 2, P15s Gen 2, T14 Gen 2, and T15 Gen 2 that could cause the system to recover to insecure settings if the BIOS becomes corrupt. CVE-2023-4030']

CVE-2022-40262', 'Intel reported potential security vulnerabilities in the BIOS firmware for some Intel Processors that may allow escalation of privilege. 2022.3 IPU, INTEL-SA-00688: CVE-2022-26006, CVE-2022-21198', 'A Time of Check Time of Use (TOCTOU) vulnerability was reported in BIOS implementations. This vulnerability is referred to by the researcher as Ringhopper. Published Date: Nuvoton TPM Denial of Service Vulnerability
Description:
A full AC power cycle (hard reset) will restore functionality to Nuvoton's NPCT65x TPM if it enters protection mode as a result of an attack related to this vulnerability.

ThinkAgile customers:
For Nutanix software, seehttps://www.nutanix.com/trust/security-advisoriesfor risk exposure, resolution and mitigations.
For VMware software and appliances, seehttps://www.vmware.com/security/advisories.htmlfor risk exposure, resolution and mitigations.

CVE IDs: ['Tianocore reported a fixed pointer vulnerability in TianoCore EDK II BIOS that may allow an attacker with local access and elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code. TianoCore EDK II is the foundational open source UEFI (BIOS) code used throughout industry in all modern computers. CVE-2021-28216', 'A buffer overflow in the WMI SMI Handler in some Lenovo models may allow an attacker with local access and elevated privileges to execute arbitrary code. CVE-2022-40137', 'An information leak vulnerability in the SMI Set BIOS Password SMI Handler in some Lenovo models may allow an attacker with local access and elevated privileges to read SMM memory. CVE-2022-40134', 'An information leak vulnerability in the Smart USB Protection SMI Handler in some Lenovo models may allow an attacker with local access and elevated privileges to read SMM memory. CVE-2022-40135', 'An information leak vulnerability in SMI Handler used to configure platform settings over WMI in some Lenovo models may allow an attacker with local access and elevated privileges to read SMM memory. CVE-2022-40136']
